Concession.definition: an act or instance of conceding or yielding 2

1.definition: an act or instance of conceding or yielding

sub_terms.b: something granted esp. as an inducement (as to enter into an agreement)
sub_terms.c: a grant of real property esp. by a government in return for services or for a particular use (as settlement)
sub_terms.d: a right to undertake a specified activity for profit on another's real property [a logging ]
sub_terms.e: a lease that grants a right to engage in a profitable activity on another's real propertythe property or portion of the property subject to such a lease
